newsitem.title: URUGUAY: Uruguayan inflation fell to 1.28 pct in March.
newsitem.headline: Uruguayan inflation fell to 1.28 pct in March.

text.p: Uruguayan consumer prices rose 1.28 percent in March, down from 1.64 percent in February and 1.92 in March 1996, the official Statistics Institute said Thursday.
March's inflation took to 4.97 percent the increase in the first quarter of 1997, against 5.54 in the same period a year earlier.
In the 12 months to March 1997, consumer prices rose 23.67 percent, down from 31.43 percent in the 12 months to March 1996, the institute said.
March consumer prices were driven by a 13.3 percent increase in the cost of education, 3.2 percent in clothing and footwear, 3.1 percent in housing and 1.2 percent in food and drinks.
Uruguayan inflation was 24.30 percent in 1996, and the government expects to end 1997 with a rate between 14 and 17 percent.
